content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/fgdc-std-001-1998.xsd" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">  <idinfo>   <citation>    <citeinfo>     <origin>Donald R Pool</origin>     <origin>Stanley Leake</origin>     <origin>Jesse Dickinson</origin>     <pubdate>2014</pubdate>     <title>Digital geospatial data points of the Paleozoic and older rocks of the Upper Colorado River Basin</title>     <geoform>Vector Digital Data Set (Point)</geoform>     <pubinfo>      <pubplace>Reston, Virginia</pubplace>      <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>     </pubinfo>     <onlink>http://water.usgs.gov/lookup/getspatial?ucrb_Paleozoic_obs</onlink>    </citeinfo>   </citation>   <descript>    <abstract>These digital point data of altitudes of the Paleozoic and older rocks of the Upper Colorado River Basin (UCRB) were created for the purpose of developing a generalized predevelopment groundwater flow model of the Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin and use that model along with a few recharge estimates to estimate water budgets for the aquifers including associated groundwater contributions to the Colorado River surface water system. The modeling exercise also explored considerations for development of a more detailed groundwater flow model that would include all of the major aquifers in the Upper Colorado River Basin.</abstract>    <purpose>These data were derived from various other sources (maps) for the calibration of the groundwater model hydraulic propertiesfor use in the development of the Upper Colorado River Basin Groundwater Flow Model.</purpose>    <supplinf>Data are as current as the publications that provided the information and maps.  For stream elevation the DEMs were processed to determine the minimum elevation within each 500m. \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffducrb_500m_minlsa.tif\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd</supplinf>   </descript>   <timeperd>    <timeinfo>     <sngdate>      <caldate>2013</caldate>     </sngdate>    </timeinfo>    <current>See Supplemental Info</current>   </timeperd>   <status>    <progress>Complete</progress>    <update>None planned</update>   </status>   <spdom>    <bounding>     <westbc>-112.216390444</westbc>     <eastbc>-105.918133878</eastbc>     <northbc>43.33249396</northbc>     <southbc>35.343805284</southbc>    </bounding>   </spdom>   <keywords>    <theme>     <themekt>None</themekt>     <themekey>inlandWaters</themekey>     <themekey>control point</themekey>     <themekey>groundwater model</themekey>     <themekey>Paleozoic aquifer</themekey>    </theme>    <place>     <placekt>None</placekt>     <placekey>Colorado</placekey>     <placekey>Arizona</placekey>     <placekey>Utah</placekey>     <placekey>New Mexico</placekey>    </place>   </keywords>   <accconst>None. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.</complete>   <posacc>    <horizpa>     <horizpar>A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.</horizpar>    </horizpa>    <vertacc>     <vertaccr>A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.</vertaccr>    </vertacc>   </posacc>   <lineage>    <srcinfo>     <srccite>      <citeinfo>       <origin>Geldon, A.L.</origin>       <pubdate>2003</pubdate> the Redwall-Muav, Coconino, and alluvial basin aquifer systems of northern and central Arizona</title>       <geoform>Other</geoform>       <pubinfo>        <pubplace>Reston, VA</pubplace>        <publish>U.S. Geological Survey</publish>       </pubinfo>       <onlink>http://pubs.usgs.gov/sir/2010/5180/</onlink>      </citeinfo>     </srccite>     <typesrc>Digital and/or Hardcopy Resources</typesrc>     <srctime>      <timeinfo>       <sngdate>        <caldate>2010</caldate>       </sngdate>      </timeinfo>      <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>     </srctime>     <srccitea>SIR 2010-5180</srccitea>     <srccontr>Water-level data used as control for steady-state simulation groundwater-flow model.</srccontr>    </srcinfo>    <procstep>     <procdesc>   1. Saved pdf version PP1411B Plate 11 as tif files. Development of the original data are by the originators of those reports.   2. Within a GIS, georeferenced the maps, and Digitized select points along the potentiometric contours of Plate 11 of PP 1411B, georeferenced and projected to UTM Zone 12, NAD83.   3. Assigned altitude values to each point.    </procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>   1. Water-level observations and well-location data downloaded from the Arizona Water Science Center's Groundwater Site Information (GWSI) system database in the southern and southeast areas of the model area in Arizona, New Mexico, and Colorado.   2. Created point shapefile from downloaded data.   3. Projected to UTM Zone 12, NAD83.   4. Appended to shapefile of PP1411B Plate 11.</procdesc>     <procdate>2013</procdate>    </procstep>    <procstep>     <procdesc>Created comma-delimited text file of point data from dataset attribute table. Projection is project projection (UTM Zone 12, NAD83)</procdesc>     <procdate>2014</procdate>    </procstep>   </lineage>  </dataqual>  <spdoinfo>   <direct>Point</direct>   <ptvctinf>    <sdtsterm> <attrdefs>Producer defined</attrdefs>     <attrdomv>      <rdom>       <rdommin>3920644.65348</rdommin>       <rdommax>4797756.45391</rdommax>       <attrunit>meters</attrunit>      </rdom>     </attrdomv>    </attr>   </detailed>   <overview>    <eaover>Observations for calibration of the groundwater model hydraulic properties to heads in the simulated Mesozoic and Paleozoic aquifers were derived from scanned and rectified map figures in several reports and a few observations at wells.  The published figures primarily included water-level contours with no plotted control water levels.  Two reports included individual observations.  Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.</eaover>    <eadetcit>Water-level observations for the Paleozoic aquifers were derived from PP-1411B (Plate 11) for most of the UCRB, and several observations from USGS GWSI at the southern and southeast boundaries of the model area in Arizona, New Mexico and Colorado many of which were used as control for the Northern Arizona Regional Groundwater Flow Model (SIR 2010\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd5180). The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set.</eadetcit>   </overview>  </eainfo>  <distinfo>   <distrib>    <cntinfo>     <cntorgp>      <cntorg>U.S. Geological Survey</cntorg>     </cntorgp>     <cntpos>Ask USGS -- Water Webserver Team</cntpos>     <cntaddr>      <addrtype>mailing address</addrtype>      <address>445 National Center</address>      <city>Reston</city>      <state>VA</state>      <postal>20192</postal>      <country>USA</country>     </cntaddr>     <cntvoice>1-888-275-8747 (1-888-ASK-USGS)</cntvoice>     <cntemail>http://water.usgs.gov/user_feedback_form.html</cntemail>    </cntinfo>   </distrib>   <distliab>Although this data set has been used by the U.S. Geological Survey, U.S. Department of the Interior, no warranty expressed or implied is made by the U.S. Geological Survey as to the accuracy of the data and related materials.
